1    | /*****
2    |  ** ** Module Header ******************************************************* **
3    |  ** 									     **
4    |  **   Modules Revision 3.0						     **
5    |  **   Providing a flexible user environment				     **
6    |  ** 									     **
7    |  **   File:		locate_module.c					     **
8    |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
9    |  ** 									     **
10   |  **   Authors:	John Furlan, jlf@behere.com				     **
11   |  **		Jens Hamisch, jens@Strawberry.COM			     **
12   |  ** 									     **
13   |  **   Description: 	Contains the routines which locate the actual	     **
14   |  **			modulefile given a modulefilename by looking in all  **
15   |  **			of the paths in MODULEPATH. 			     **
16   |  ** 									     **
17   |  **   Exports:		Locate_ModuleFile				     **
18   |  **			SortedDirList					     **
19   |  **			SplitIntoList					     **
20   |  **			FreeList					     **
21   |  **			SourceRC					     **
22   |  **			SourceVers					     **
23   |  ** 									     **
24   |  **   Notes:								     **
25   |  ** 									     **
26   |  ** ************************************************************************ **
27   |  ****/
28   | 
29   | /** ** Copyright *********************************************************** **
30   |  ** 									     **
31   |  ** Copyright 1991-1994 by John L. Furlan.                      	     **
32   |  ** see LICENSE.GPL, which must be provided, for details		     **
33   |  ** 									     ** 
34   |  ** ************************************************************************ **/
35   | 
36   | static char Id[] = "@(#)$Id: locate_module.c.src.html,v 1.9 2009/09/02 20:37:41 rkowen Exp $";
37   | static void *UseId[] = { &UseId, Id };
38   |

52   | /** 				     CONSTANTS				     **/
53   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
54   | 
55   | #define	SRCFRAG	100
56   | 
57   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
58   | /**				      MACROS				     **/
59   | /** ************************************************************************ **/

61   | /** not applicable **/

66   | 
67   | static	char	module_name[] = __FILE__;
68   | 
69   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE
70   | static	char	_proc_Locate_ModuleFile[] = "Locate_ModuleFile";
71   | #endif
72   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE_1
73   | static	char	_proc_GetModuleName[] = "GetModuleName";
74   | #endif
75   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
76   | static	char	_proc_SortedDirList[] = "SortedDirList";
77   | static	char	_proc_SplitIntoList[] = "SplitIntoList";
78   | #endif
79   | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
80   | static	char	_proc_FreeList[] = "FreeList";
81   | #endif
82   | 
83   | static	char	buf[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
84   | static	char	modfil_buf[ MOD_BUFSIZE];
85   | 
86   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
87   | /**				    PROTOTYPES				     **/
88   | /** ************************************************************************ **/
89   | 
90   | static	int	  filename_compare( const void*, const void*);
91   | static	char	 *GetModuleName( Tcl_Interp*, char*, char*, char*);
92   | 
93   | /*++++
94   |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
95   |  ** 									     **
96   |  **   Function:		filename_compare				     **
97   |  ** 									     **
98   |  **   Description: 	This is a reverse compare function to reverse the    **
99   |  **			filename list. The function is used as compare func- **
100  |  **			tion for qsort.					     **
101  |  ** 									     **
102  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
103  |  ** 									     **
104  |  **   Parameters:	const void	*fi1	First filename to compare    **
105  |  **			const void	*fi2	Second filename to compare   **
106  |  ** 									     **
107  |  **   Result:		int	-1	filename 1 > filename 2		     **
108  |  **				0	filename 1 == filename 2	     **
109  |  **				1	filename 1 < filename 2		     **
110  |  ** 									     **
111  |  **   Attached Globals:							     **
112  |  ** 									     **
113  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
114  |  ++++*/
115  | 
116  | static int  filename_compare(	const void	*fi1,
117  | 				const void	*fi2)
118  | {
119  |     return strcmp(*(char**)fi2, *(char**)fi1);
120  | }
121  | 
122  | /*++++
123  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
124  |  ** 									     **
125  |  **   Function:		Locate_ModuleFile				     **
126  |  ** 									     **
127  |  **   Description:	Searches for a modulefile given a string argument    **
128  |  **			which is either a full path or a modulefile name     **
129  |  **			-- usually the argument the user gave. If it's not a **
130  |  **			full path, the directories in the MODULESPATH	     **
131  |  **			environment variable are searched to find a match    **
132  |  **			for the given name.				     **
133  |  ** 									     **
134  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
135  |  ** 									     **
136  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Attached Tcl interpr.**
137  |  **			char		*modulename	Name of the module to**
138  |  **							be located	     **
139  |  **			char		*realname	Real modulename (with**
140  |  **							version)	     **
141  |  **			char		*filename	Real    full module  **
142  |  **							file path	     **
143  |  ** 									     **
144  |  **   Result:		int		TCL_OK or TCL_ERROR		     **
145  |  **			filename	the full path of the required module **
146  |  **					file is copied in here		     **
147  |  ** 									     **
148  |  **   Attached Globals:	g_current_module	The module which is handled  **
149  |  **						by the current command	     **
150  |  ** 									     **
151  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
152  |  ++++*/
153  | 
154  | int Locate_ModuleFile(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
155  |                   	char		*modulename,
156  |                   	char		*realname,
157  |                   	char		*filename)
158  | {
159  |     char	*p;			/** Tokenization pointer	     **/
160  |     char	*result = NULL;		/** This functions result	     **/
161  |     char	**pathlist;		/** List of paths to scan	     **/
162  |     int		  numpaths,		/** Size of this list		     **/
163  |     		  i;			/** Loop counter		     **/
164  |     char	*modulespath;		/** Buffer for the contents of the   **/
165  | 					/** environment variable MODULEPATH  **/
166  |     char	*mod, *vers;		/** Module and version name for sym- **/
167  | 					/** bolic name lookup		     **/
168  |     /**
169  |      **  If it is a full path name, that's the module file to load.
170  |      **/
171  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE
172  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_Locate_ModuleFile, "modulename = '",
173  | 	modulename, "'", NULL);
174  | #endif
175  | 
176  |     if( !modulename) 
177  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_PARAM, LOC, "modulename", NULL))
178  | 	    goto unwind0;
179  | 	
180  |     if( modulename[0] == '/' || modulename[0] == '.') {
181  | 
182  | 	p = (char*) strrchr( modulename, '/');
183  |         if(p) {
184  |             *p = '\0';
185  | 	    /**
186  | 	     **  Check, if what has been specified is a valid version of
187  | 	     **  the specified module ...
188  | 	     **/
189  |             if((char *) NULL ==
190  | 		(result = GetModuleName(interp, modulename, NULL,(p+1)))) 
191  | 		goto unwind0;
192  | 	    /**
193  | 	     **  Reinstall the 'modulefile' which has been corrupted by
194  | 	     **   tokenization
195  | 	     **/
196  | 	    *p = '/';
197  | 
198  | 	    /**
199  | 	     **  ... Looks good! Conditionally (if there has been no version
200  | 	     **  specified) we have to add the default version
201  | 	     **/
202  |             if( !strcmp((p + 1), result)) {
203  |                 if ((char *) NULL == stringer( filename, MOD_BUFSIZE,
204  | 		modulename, NULL))
205  | 		    goto unwind1;
206  |             } else {
207  |                 if ((char *) NULL == stringer( filename, MOD_BUFSIZE,
208  | 		modulename,"/",result, NULL))
209  | 		    goto unwind1;
210  |             }
211  |         } else {
212  | 	    /**
213  | 	     **  Hmm! There's no backslash in 'modulename'. So it MUST begin
214  | 	     **  on '.' and MUST be part of the current directory
215  | 	     **/
216  |             if( NULL == (result = GetModuleName( interp, modulename, NULL,
217  | 		modulename)))
218  | 		goto unwind0;
219  | 	
220  |             if( !strcmp( modulename, result) ||
221  | 		(strlen( modulename) + 1 + strlen( result) + 1 > MOD_BUFSIZE)) {
222  |                 if ((char *) NULL == stringer( filename, MOD_BUFSIZE,
223  | 		modulename, NULL))
224  | 		    goto unwind1;
225  |             } else {
226  |                 if ((char *) NULL == stringer( filename, MOD_BUFSIZE,
227  | 		modulename,"/",result, NULL))
228  | 		    goto unwind1;
229  |             }
230  |         }
231  |     /**
232  |      **  So it is not a full path name what has been specified. Scan the 
233  |      **  MODULESPATH
234  |      **/
235  |     } else {
236  | 	/**
237  | 	 **  If I don't find a path in MODULEPATH, there's nothing to search.
238  | 	 **/
239  | 	if( !( modulespath = (char *) getenv( "MODULEPATH"))) {
240  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_MODULE_PATH, LOC, NULL)) {
241  | 		g_current_module = NULL;
242  | 		goto unwind0;
243  | 	    }
244  | 	}
245  | 	/**
246  | 	 ** strip off any extraneous new lines
247  | 	 **/
248  | 	{ char *end;
249  | 	if ((char *) NULL != (end = strrchr(modulespath, '\n'))) *end = '\0';
250  | 	}
251  | 	/**
252  | 	 **  Expand the module name (in case it is a symbolic one). This must
253  | 	 **  be done once here in order to expand any aliases
254  | 	 **/
255  | 	if( VersionLookup( modulename, &mod, &vers)) {
256  | 	    if ((char *) NULL == stringer( buf, MOD_BUFSIZE,
257  | 	    mod,"/",vers, NULL))
258  | 		goto unwind0;
259  | 	    modulename = buf;
260  | 	}
261  | 	/**
262  | 	 **  Split up the MODULEPATH values into multiple directories
263  | 	 **/
264  | 	if( NULL == (pathlist = SplitIntoList(interp, modulespath, &numpaths,
265  | 	_colon)))
266  | 	    goto unwind0;
267  | 	/**
268  | 	 **  Check each directory to see if it contains the module
269  | 	 **/
270  | 	for(i=0; i<numpaths; i++) {
271  | 	    /* skip empty paths */
272  | 	    if(*pathlist[i] && (NULL != (result =
273  | 		GetModuleName( interp, pathlist[i], NULL, modulename)))) {
274  | 
275  | 		if( strlen( pathlist[i]) + 2 + strlen( result) > MOD_BUFSIZE) {
276  | 		    if ((char *) NULL == stringer( filename, MOD_BUFSIZE,
277  | 		    pathlist[i], NULL))
278  | 			goto unwind1;
279  | 		} else {
280  | 		    if ((char *) NULL == stringer( filename, MOD_BUFSIZE,
281  | 		    pathlist[i],"/",result, NULL))
282  | 			goto unwind1;
283  | 		}
284  | 		break;
285  | 	    }
286  | 	    /**
287  | 	     **  If we havn't found it, we should try to re-expand the module
288  | 	     **  name, because some rc file have been sourced
289  | 	     **/
290  | 	    if( VersionLookup( modulename, &mod, &vers)) {
291  |                 if ((char *) NULL == stringer( buf, MOD_BUFSIZE,
292  | 		mod,"/",vers, NULL))
293  | 		    goto unwind1;
294  | 		modulename = buf;
295  | 	    }
296  | 	} /** for **/
297  | 	/**
298  | 	 **  Free the memory created from the call to SplitIntoList()
299  | 	 **/
300  | 	FreeList( pathlist, numpaths);
301  | 	/**
302  | 	 **  If result still NULL, then we really never found it and we should
303  | 	 **  return ERROR and clear the full_path array for cleanliness.
304  | 	 **/
305  | 	if( !result) {
306  | 	    filename[0] = '\0';
307  | 	    goto unwind0;
308  | 	}
309  |     } /** not a full path name **/	
310  |     /**
311  |      **  Free up what has been allocated and pass the result back to
312  |      **  the caller and save the real module file name returned by
313  |      **  GetModuleName
314  |      **/
315  |     strncpy( realname, result, MOD_BUFSIZE);
316  |     if ((char *) NULL == stringer( realname, MOD_BUFSIZE, result, NULL))
317  | 	goto unwind1;
318  |     null_free((void *) &result);
319  | 
320  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE
321  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_Locate_ModuleFile, NULL);
322  | #endif
323  | 
324  |     return( TCL_OK);
325  | 
326  | unwind1:
327  |     null_free((void *) &result);
328  | unwind0:
329  |     return( TCL_ERROR);
330  | }
331  | 
332  | /*++++
333  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
334  |  ** 									     **
335  |  **   Function:		GetModuleName					     **
336  |  ** 									     **
337  |  **   Description:	Given a path and a module filename, this function    **
338  |  **			checks to find the modulefile.			     **
339  |  ** 									     **
340  |  **   Notes:		This function is RECURSIVE			     **
341  |  **									     **
342  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
343  |  ** 									     **
344  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl Interp.**
345  |  **			char		*path		Path to start seeking**
346  |  **			char		*prefix		Module name prefix   **
347  |  **			char		*modulename	Name of the module   **
348  |  ** 									     **
349  |  **   Result:		char*	NULL	Any failure( parameters, alloc)	     **
350  |  **				else	Pointer to an allocated buffer con-  **
351  |  **					taining the complete module file path**
352  |  ** 									     **
353  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
354  |  ** 									     **
355  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
356  |  ++++*/
357  | 
358  | static	char	*GetModuleName(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
359  | 			     	char		*path,
360  | 				char		*prefix,
361  | 			     	char		*modulename)
362  | {
363  |     struct stat	  stats;		/** Buffer for the stat() systemcall **/
364  |     char	 *fullpath = NULL;	/** Buffer for creating path names   **/
365  |     char	 *Result = NULL;	/** Our return value		     **/
366  |     char	**filelist = NULL;	/** Buffer for a list of possible    **/
367  | 					/** module files		     **/
368  |     int		  numlist;		/** Size of this list		     **/
369  |     int		  i, slen, is_def;
370  |     char	 *s, *t;		/** Private string buffer	     **/
371  |     char	 *mod, *ver;		/** Pointer to module and version    **/
372  |     char	 *mod1, *ver1;		/** Temp pointer		     **/
373  |     
374  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE_1
375  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_GetModuleName, NULL);
376  | #endif
377  |     /**
378  |      **  Split the modulename into module and version. Use a private buffer
379  |      **  for this
380  |      **/
381  |     if((char *) NULL == (s = stringer(NULL, 0,  modulename, NULL))) {
382  | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
383  | 	goto unwind0;
384  |     }
385  |     slen = strlen( s) + 1;
386  |     mod = s;
387  |     if( (ver = strchr( mod, '/')) )
388  | 	*ver++ = '\0';
389  |     /**
390  |      **  Allocate a buffer for full pathname building
391  |      **/
392  |     if((char *) NULL == (fullpath = stringer(NULL, MOD_BUFSIZE, NULL))) {
393  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL)) {
394  | 	    goto unwind1;
395  | 	}
396  |     }
397  |     /**
398  |      **  Check whether $path/$prefix/$mod is a directory
399  |      **/
400  |     if( prefix) {
401  | 	if((char *) NULL == stringer(fullpath, MOD_BUFSIZE,
402  | 	path,"/",prefix,"/",mod, NULL))
403  | 	    goto unwind1;
404  |     } else {
405  | 	if((char *) NULL == stringer(fullpath, MOD_BUFSIZE,
406  | 	path,"/",mod, NULL))
407  | 	    goto unwind1;
408  |     }
409  |     is_def = !strcmp( mod, _(em_default));
410  | 
411  |     if( is_def || !stat( fullpath, &stats)) {
412  | 	/**
413  | 	 **  If it is a directory
414  | 	 **/
415  |     	if( !is_def && S_ISDIR( stats.st_mode)) {
416  | 	    /**
417  | 	     **  Source the ".modulerc" file if it exists
418  | 	     **  For compatibility source the .version file, too
419  | 	     **/
420  | 	    if( prefix) {
421  | 		if((char *) NULL == stringer(modfil_buf, MOD_BUFSIZE,
422  | 		path,"/",mod, NULL))
423  | 		    goto unwind2;
424  | 	    } else {
425  | 		if((char *) NULL == stringer(modfil_buf, MOD_BUFSIZE,mod, NULL))
426  | 		    goto unwind2;
427  | 	    }
428  | 
429  | 	    if((char *) NULL == stringer(fullpath, MOD_BUFSIZE,
430  | 	    path,"/",modfil_buf, NULL))
431  | 		goto unwind2;
432  | 	    g_current_module = modfil_buf;
433  | 
434  | 	    if( TCL_ERROR == SourceRC( interp, fullpath, modulerc_file) ||
435  | 		TCL_ERROR == SourceVers( interp, fullpath, modfil_buf)) {
436  | 		/* flags = save_flags; */
437  | 		    goto unwind2;
438  | 	    }
439  | 	    /**
440  | 	     **  After sourcing the RC files, we have to look up versions again
441  | 	     **/
442  | 	    if( VersionLookup( modulename, &mod1, &ver1)) {
443  | 		int len = strlen( mod1) + strlen( ver1) + 2;
444  | 		/**
445  | 		 **  Maybe we have to enlarge s
446  | 		 **/
447  | 		if( len > slen) {
448  | 		    null_free((void *) &s);
449  | 		    if((char *) NULL == (s = stringer( NULL, len, NULL))) {
450  | 			ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
451  | 			goto unwind2;
452  | 		    }
453  | 		    slen = len;
454  | 		}
455  | 		/**
456  | 		 **  Print the new module/version in the buffer
457  | 		 **/
458  | 		if((char *) NULL == stringer( s, len, mod1,"/", ver1, NULL)) {
459  | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
460  | 		    goto unwind2;
461  | 		}
462  | 		mod = s;
463  | 		if( (ver = strchr( s, '/')) )
464  | 		    *ver++ = '\0';
465  | 	    }
466  | 	    /**
467  | 	     **  recursively delve into subdirectories (until ver == NULL).
468  | 	     **/
469  | 	    if( ver) {
470  | 		int len = strlen( mod) + 1;
471  | 
472  | 		if( prefix)
473  | 		    len += strlen( prefix) +1;
474  | 		/**
475  | 		 **  Build the new prefix
476  | 		 **/
477  | 		if((char *) NULL == (t = stringer(NULL, len, NULL))) {
478  | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
479  | 		    goto unwind2;
480  | 		}
481  | 
482  | 		if( prefix) {
483  | 		    if((char *) NULL == stringer(t, len, prefix,"/",mod, NULL)){
484  | 			ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
485  | 			goto unwindt;
486  | 		    }
487  | 		} else {
488  | 		    if((char *) NULL == stringer(t, len, mod, NULL)){
489  | 			ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
490  | 			goto unwindt;
491  | 		    }
492  | 		}
493  | 		/**
494  | 		 **  This is the recursion
495  | 		 **/
496  | 		Result = GetModuleName( interp, path, t, ver);
497  | 
498  | 		/**
499  | 		 **  Free our temporary prefix buffer
500  | 		 **/
501  | 		null_free((void *) &t);
502  | 		if (0) {	/* an error occurred */
503  | unwindt:
504  | 		    null_free((void *) &t);
505  | 		    goto unwind2;
506  | 		}
507  | 	    } 
508  | 	} else {     /** if( $path/$prefix/$mod is a directory) **/
509  | 	    /**
510  | 	     **  Now 'mod' should be either a file or the word 'default'
511  | 	     **  In case of default get the file with the highest version number
512  | 	     **  in the current directory
513  | 	     **/
514  | 	    if( is_def) {
515  | 		if( !prefix)
516  | 		    prefix = ".";
517  | 		if( NULL == (filelist = SortedDirList( interp, path, prefix,
518  | 		&numlist)))
519  | 		    goto unwind1;
520  | 
521  | 		prefix = (char *) NULL;
522  | 		/**
523  | 		 **  Select the first one on the list which is either a
524  | 		 **  modulefile or another directory. We start at the highest
525  | 		 **  lexicographical name in the directory since the filelist
526  | 		 **  is reverse sorted.
527  | 		 **  If it's a directory, we delve into it.
528  | 		 **/
529  | 		for( i=0; i<numlist && Result==NULL; i++) {
530  | 		    /**
531  | 		     **  Build the full path name and check if it is a
532  | 		     **  directory. If it is, recursively try to find there what
533  | 		     **  we're seeking for
534  | 		     **/
535  | 		    if ((char *)NULL == stringer(fullpath, MOD_BUFSIZE,
536  | 			path, "/", filelist[i], NULL))
537  | 			    goto unwind2;
538  | 
539  | 		    if( !stat( fullpath, &stats) && S_ISDIR( stats.st_mode)) {
540  | 			Result = GetModuleName( interp, path, prefix,
541  | 			    filelist[ i]);
542  | 		    } else {
543  | 			/**
544  | 			 **  Otherwise check the file for a magic cookie ...
545  | 			 **/
546  | 			if( check_magic( fullpath, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE, 
547  | 			    MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH)) 
548  | 			    Result = filelist[ i];
549  | 		    } /** if( !stat) **/
550  | 		} /** for **/
551  | 	    } else {  /** default **/
552  | 		/**
553  | 		 **  If mod names a file, we have to check wheter it exists and
554  | 		 **  is a valid module file
555  | 		 **/
556  | 		if( check_magic( fullpath, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE, 
557  | 		    MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH)) 
558  | 		    Result = mod;
559  | 		else {
560  | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_MAGIC, LOC, fullpath, NULL);
561  | 		    Result = NULL;
562  | 		}
563  | 	    } /** if( mod is a filename) **/
564  | 	    /**
565  | 	     **  Build the full filename (using prefix and Result) if
566  | 	     **  Result is defined
567  | 	     **/
568  | 	    if( Result) {
569  | 		int len = strlen( Result) + 1;
570  | 
571  | 		if( prefix)
572  | 		    len += strlen( prefix) + 1;
573  | 
574  | 		if((char *) NULL == (t = stringer(NULL, len, NULL))) {
575  | 		   ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL);
576  | 		   goto unwind2;
577  | 		}
578  | 		if( prefix) {
579  | 		    if((char *) NULL == stringer(t,len, prefix,"/",Result,NULL))
580  | 			goto unwindt2;
581  | 		} else {
582  | 		    if((char *) NULL == stringer(t,len, Result,NULL))
583  | 			goto unwindt2;
584  | 		}
585  | 		Result = t;
586  | 		if (0) {	/* an error occurred */
587  | unwindt2:
588  | 		    null_free((void *) &t);
589  | 		    goto unwind2;
590  | 		}
591  | 	    } 
592  | 	} /** mod is a file **/
593  |     } /** mod exists **/
594  |     /**
595  |      **  Free up temporary values and return what we've found
596  |      **/
597  |     null_free((void*) &fullpath);
598  |     null_free((void*) &s);
599  |     FreeList( filelist, numlist);
600  |     
601  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_LOCATE_1
602  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_GetModuleName, NULL);
603  | #endif
604  |     return( Result);			/** -------- EXIT (SUCCESS) -------> **/
605  | 
606  | unwind2:
607  |     null_free((void *) &fullpath);
608  | unwind1:
609  |     null_free((void *) &s);
610  | unwind0:
611  |     return(NULL);			/** -------- EXIT (FAILURE) -------> **/
612  | 
613  | } /** End of 'GetModuleName' **/
614  | 
615  | /*++++
616  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
617  |  ** 									     **
618  |  **   Function:		SortedDirList					     **
619  |  ** 									     **
620  |  **   Description:	Checks the given path for the given modulefile.	     **
621  |  **			If the path + the module filename is the modulefile, **
622  |  **			then it is returned as the first element in the list.**
623  |  **			If the path + the module filename is a directory, the**
624  |  **			directory is read and sorted as the list.	     **
625  |  ** 									     **
626  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
627  |  ** 									     **
628  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl Interp.**
629  |  **			char		*path		Path to start seeking**
630  |  **			char		*modulename	Name of the module   **
631  |  **			int		*listcnt	Buffer to return the **
632  |  **							size of the created  **
633  |  **							list in elements     **
634  |  ** 									     **
635  |  **   Result:		char**		NULL	Any failure (alloc, param)   **
636  |  **					else	Base pointer to the newly    **
637  |  **						created list.		     **
638  |  **			*listcnt		Number of elements in the    **
639  |  **						list if one was created, un- **
640  |  **						changed otherwise	     **
641  |  ** 									     **
642  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
643  |  ** 									     **
644  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
645  |  ++++*/
646  | 
647  | char	**SortedDirList(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
648  | 		     		char		*path,
649  | 		     		char		*modulename,
650  | 		     		int		*listcnt)
651  | {
652  |     struct dirent	*file;		/** Directory entry		     **/
653  |     struct stat    	 stats;		/** Stat buffer			     **/
654  |     DIR			*subdirp;	/** Subdirectoy handle		     **/
655  |     char		*full_path;	/** Sugg. full path (path + module)  **/
656  |     char		**filelist;	/** Temp. base pointer of the list   **/
657  |     int			 i,		/** Number of entries in the subdir  **/
658  | 			 j,		/** Counts the number of list-entries**/
659  | 			 n,		/** Size of the allocated array	     **/
660  | 			 pathlen;	/** String length of 'fullpath'	     **/
661  |  
662  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
663  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_SortedDirList, NULL);
664  | #endif
665  |     /**
666  |      **  Allocate memory for the list to be created. Suggest a list size of
667  |      **  100 Elements. This may be changed later on.
668  |      **/
669  |     if( NULL == (filelist = (char**) calloc( n = 100, sizeof(char*))))
670  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
671  | 	    goto unwind0;
672  |     /**
673  |      **  Form the suggested module file name out of the passed path and 
674  |      **  the name of the module. Alloc memory in order to do this.
675  |      **/
676  |     if((char *) NULL == (full_path = stringer(NULL, 0,
677  | 	path,"/",modulename, NULL)))
678  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
679  | 	    goto unwind0;
680  |     pathlen = strlen(full_path);
681  |     
682  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
683  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_DEBUG, LOC, "full_path='", full_path, "'", NULL);
684  | #endif
685  |     /**
686  |      **  Check whether this file exists. If it doesn't free up everything
687  |      **  and return on failure
688  |      **/
689  |     if( stat( full_path, &stats))
690  | 	goto unwind2;
691  |     /**
692  |      **  If the suggested module file is a regular one, we've found what we've
693  |      **  seeked for. Put it on the top of the list and return.
694  |      **/
695  |     if( S_ISREG( stats.st_mode)) {
696  | 	*listcnt = 1;
697  | 	filelist[0] = stringer(NULL,0, modulename, NULL);
698  | 
699  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
700  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_DEBUG, LOC, "Module '", modulename, "' found", NULL);
701  | #endif
702  | 
703  | 	null_free((void*) &full_path);
704  | 	return( filelist);		/** --- EXIT PROCEDURE (SUCCESS) --> **/
705  |     }
706  |     /**
707  |      **  What we've found is a directory
708  |      **/
709  |     if( S_ISDIR( stats.st_mode)) {
710  |         char	*tbuf;		/** Buffer for the whole filename for each   **/
711  | 				/** content of the directory		     **/
712  |         char	*mpath;		/** Pointer into *tbuf where to write the dir**/
713  | 				/** entry				     **/
714  | 
715  | 	/**
716  | 	 **  Open the directory for reading
717  | 	 **/
718  | 	if( NULL == (subdirp = opendir( full_path))) {
719  | #if 0
720  | 	/* if you can't open the directory ... is that really an error? */
721  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_OPENDIR, LOC, full_path, NULL))
722  | #endif
723  | 	    goto unwind2;
724  | 	}
725  | 	/**
726  | 	 **  Allocate a buffer for constructing complete file names
727  | 	 **  and initialize it with the directory part we do already know.
728  | 	 **/
729  |         if( NULL == (tbuf = stringer(NULL, MOD_BUFSIZE, full_path,"/", NULL)))
730  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
731  | 		goto unwind3;
732  | 
733  |         mpath = (tbuf + pathlen + 1);
734  | 	/**
735  | 	 **  Now scan all entries of the just opened directory
736  | 	 **/
737  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
738  | 	ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_DEBUG, LOC, "Reading directory '", full_path, "'", NULL);
739  | #endif
740  | 	for( file = readdir( subdirp), i = 0, j = 0;
741  | 	     file != NULL;
742  | 	     file = readdir( subdirp), i++) {
743  | 	    /**
744  | 	     **  Oops! This one exceeds our array. Enlarge it.
745  | 	     **/
746  | 	    if( j == n)
747  | 		if( NULL == (filelist =
748  | 		    (char**) realloc((char*) filelist, (n*=2)*sizeof(char*))))
749  | 		    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
750  | 			goto unwindt;
751  | 	    /**
752  | 	     **  Now, if we got a real entry which is not '.*' or '..' and
753  | 	     **  finally is not a temporary file (which are defined to end
754  | 	     **  on '~' ...
755  | 	     **/
756  | 	    if( file->d_name                && 
757  |                 *file->d_name != '.'        && 
758  |                 strcmp( file->d_name, "..")  &&
759  |                 file->d_name[ NLENGTH( file) - 1] != '~') {
760  | 		/**
761  | 		 **  ... build the full pathname and check for the magic
762  | 		 **  cookie or for another directory level in order to
763  | 		 **  validate this as a modulefile entry we're seeking for.
764  | 		 **/
765  |                 strcpy( mpath, file->d_name);
766  |                 if( check_magic( tbuf, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE,
767  | 			MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH) ||
768  | 		    !stat(tbuf, &stats) ) {
769  | 		    /**
770  | 		     **  Yep! Found! Put it on the list
771  | 		     **/
772  |                     if((char *) NULL == (filelist[j] = stringer(NULL,0,
773  | 			modulename,"/",file->d_name, NULL)))
774  | 			if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
775  | 			    goto unwindt;
776  | 		    j++;
777  |                 } /** if( mag. cookie or directory) **/
778  | 	    } /** if( not a dotfile) **/
779  | 	} /** for **/
780  | 	/**
781  | 	 **  Put a terminator at the lists end and then sort the list
782  | 	 **/
783  |         filelist[ j] = NULL;
784  | 	qsort( (void*) filelist, (size_t) j, sizeof(char*), filename_compare);
785  | 	/**
786  | 	 **  Free up temporary values ...
787  | 	 **/
788  | 	if( -1 == closedir( subdirp))
789  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSEDIR, LOC, full_path, NULL)) {
790  | 		goto unwind2;
791  | 	    }
792  | 	null_free((void*) &full_path);
793  | 	null_free((void*) &tbuf);
794  | 	/**
795  | 	 **  Set up return values and pass the created list to the caller
796  | 	 **/
797  | 	*listcnt = j;
798  | 	return( filelist);		/** --- EXIT PROCEDURE (SUCCESS) --> **/
799  | 	
800  | 	if(0) {	
801  | unwindt:
802  | 	    null_free((void*) &tbuf);
803  | 	    goto unwind3;
804  | 	}
805  |     }
806  |     /**
807  |      **  If it is nor a regular file, neither a directory, we don't support
808  |      **  it at all ...
809  |      **/
810  | /** ??? What about links ??? **/
811  | 
812  | unwind3:
813  |     if( -1 == closedir( subdirp))
814  | 	ErrorLogger( ERR_CLOSEDIR, LOC, full_path, NULL);
815  | unwind2:
816  |     null_free((void*) &full_path);
817  | unwind1:
818  |     FreeList( filelist, n);
819  | 
820  | unwind0:
821  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
822  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_END, LOC, _proc_SortedDirList, NULL);
823  | #endif
824  | 
825  |     return( NULL);			/** --- EXIT PROCEDURE (FAILURE) --> **/
826  | 
827  | } /** End of 'SortedDirList' **/
828  | 
829  | /*++++
830  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
831  |  ** 									     **
832  |  **   Function:		SplitIntoList					     **
833  |  ** 									     **
834  |  **   Description: 	Splits a path-type environment variable into an array**
835  |  **			of char* list.					     **
836  |  ** 									     **
837  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
838  |  ** 									     **
839  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		According Tcl Interp.**
840  |  **			char		*pathenv	Path to split 	     **
841  |  **			int		*numpaths	Buffer to write the  **
842  |  **							number of array ele- **
843  |  **							ments to.	     **
844  |  ** 									     **
845  |  **   Result:		char**		NULL	Any failure (alloc, param.)  **
846  |  **					else	Base pointer of the created  **
847  |  **						array			     **
848  |  **			*numpaths		Number of elements if an ar- **
849  |  **						ray has been created, unchan-**
850  |  **						ged otherwise.		     **
851  |  ** 									     **
852  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
853  |  ** 									     **
854  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
855  |  ++++*/
856  | 
857  | char	**SplitIntoList(	Tcl_Interp	*interp,
858  | 		     		char		*pathenv, 
859  | 		     		int		*numpaths,
860  | 				const char	*delim) 
861  | {
862  |     char	**pathlist = NULL;	/** Temporary base pointer for the   **/
863  | 					/** array to be created		     **/
864  |     char	 *givenpath = NULL;	/** Temporary buffer used to tokenize**/
865  | 					/** the passed input path	     **/
866  |     char	 *dirname = NULL;	/** Token pointer		     **/
867  |     int     	  i, 			/** Counts the number of elements    **/
868  | 		  n;			/** Size of the array		     **/
869  | 
870  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_1
871  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_SplitIntoList, NULL);
872  | #endif
873  |     /** 
874  |      **  Paramter check
875  |      **/
876  |     if( !pathenv)
877  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_PARAM, LOC, "pathenv", NULL))
878  | 	    goto unwind0;
879  |     /**
880  |      **  Allocate space to copy in the value of the path value to
881  |      **  split. Thus this procedure doesn't change its input parameters.
882  |      **/
883  |     if( (char *) NULL == (givenpath = stringer(NULL,0, pathenv,NULL)))
884  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
885  | 	    goto unwind0;
886  |     /**
887  |      **  Allocate the list which is an array of char*.  n is used to
888  |      **  manage the array's growth if there are more than 100 paths in
889  |      **  the list.
890  |      **  Copy the passed path into the new buffer.
891  |      **/
892  |     if((char **) NULL == (pathlist = (char**) calloc(n = 100,sizeof( char*))))
893  | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
894  | 	    goto unwind1;
895  |     /**
896  |      **  Split the given path environment variable into its components.
897  |      **/
898  |     for( i=0, dirname = xstrtok( givenpath, delim);
899  |          dirname;
900  | 	 dirname = xstrtok( NULL, delim)) {
901  | 	/**
902  | 	 **  Oops! The number of tokens exceed my array - reallocate it
903  | 	 **  and double its size!
904  | 	 **/
905  | 	if( i == n )
906  | 	    if((char **) NULL == (pathlist = (char**) realloc((char*) pathlist,
907  | 		(n *= 2)*sizeof(char*))))
908  | 		if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL))
909  | 		    goto unwind1;
910  | 	/**
911  | 	 **  Put the token into the array. Therefor a new area is allocated for
912  | 	 **  the token using 'xdup' - which expands 1 level of env.vars.
913  | 	 **/
914  | 	if( NULL == (pathlist[ i++] = xdup( dirname)))
915  | 	    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL)) {
916  | 		FreeList( pathlist, --i);
917  | 		goto unwind1;
918  | 	    }
919  |     } /** for **/
920  |     /**
921  |      **  Free up the temporary working array
922  |      **/
923  |     if( givenpath)
924  | 	null_free((void*) &givenpath);
925  |     /**
926  |      **  Set up the return value (Number of elements allocated) and pass
927  |      **  the arrays base pointer to the caller
928  |      **/
929  |     *numpaths = i;
930  |     return( pathlist);
931  | 
932  | unwind1:
933  |     null_free((void *) &givenpath);
934  | unwind0:
935  |     return( NULL);			/** -------- EXIT FAILURE -------> **/
936  | } /** End of 'SplitIntoList' **/
937  | 
938  | #ifndef FreeList
939  | 
940  | /*++++
941  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
942  |  ** 									     **
943  |  **   Function:		FreeList					     **
944  |  ** 									     **
945  |  **   Description:	Frees a char* array type list.			     **
946  |  ** 									     **
947  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
948  |  ** 									     **
949  |  **   Parameters:	char	**list		Pointer to the list	     **
950  |  **			int	  numelem	Number of elements in the    **
951  |  ** 						list			     **
952  |  **   Result:		-						     **
953  |  ** 									     **
954  |  **   Attached Globals:	-						     **
955  |  ** 									     **
956  |  ** ************************************************************************ **
957  |  ++++*/
958  | 
959  | void FreeList(	char	**list,
960  | 		int	  numelem)
961  | {
962  |     register int j;
963  |     
964  | #if WITH_DEBUGGING_UTIL_2
965  |     ErrorLogger( NO_ERR_START, LOC, _proc_FreeList, NULL);
966  | #endif
967  |     /**
968  |      **  Nothing to do ?
969  |      **/
970  |     if( !list)
971  | 	return;
972  |     /**
973  |      **  Free all elements of the list
974  |      **/
975  |     for( j = 0; j < numelem; j++)
976  | 	if( list[j] != NULL)
977  | 	    null_free((void *) (list + j));
978  |     /**
979  |      **  Free the entire list
980  |      **/
981  |     null_free((void *) &list);
982  | 
983  | } /** End of 'FreeList' **/
984  | 
985  | #endif
986  | 
987  | /*++++
988  |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
989  |  ** 									     **
990  |  **   Function:		SourceRC					     **
991  |  ** 									     **
992  |  **   Description:	Source the passed global RC file		     **
993  |  ** 									     **
994  |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
995  |  ** 									     **
996  |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Tcl interpreter	     **
997  |  **			char		*path		Path to be used      **
998  |  **			char		*name		Name of the RC file  **
999  |  **									     **
1000 |  **   Result:		int		TCL_OK		Success		     **
1001 |  **					TCL_ERROR	Failure		     **
1002 |  **									     **
1003 |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
1004 |  **					this function is called in order to  **
1005 |  **					control everything		     **
1006 |  ** 									     **
1007 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1008 |  ++++*/
1009 | 
1010 | int SourceRC( Tcl_Interp *interp, char *path, char *name)
1011 | {
1012 |     struct stat	  stats;		/** Buffer for the stat() systemcall **/
1013 |     int 	  save_flags, i;
1014 |     char	 *buffer;
1015 |     int		  Result = TCL_OK;
1016 |     static char	**srclist = (char **) NULL;
1017 |     static int	  listsize = 0, listndx = 0;
1018 | 
1019 |     /**
1020 |      **  If there's a problem with the input parameters it means, that
1021 |      **  we do not have to source anything
1022 |      **  Only a valid TCL interpreter should be there
1023 |      **/
1024 |     if( !path || !name)
1025 | 	return( TCL_OK);
1026 | 
1027 |     if( !interp)
1028 | 	return( TCL_ERROR);
1029 |     /**
1030 |      **  Build the full name of the RC file
1031 |      **  Avoid duplicate sourcing
1032 |      **/
1033 |     if ((char *) NULL == (buffer = stringer(NULL, 0, path,"/",name, NULL)))
1034 | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
1035 | 	    goto unwind0;
1036 |     for( i=0; i<listndx; i++)
1037 | 	if( !strcmp( srclist[ i], buffer))
1038 | 	    goto unwind1;
1039 |     /**
1040 |      **  Check whether the RC file exists and has the magic cookie inside
1041 |      **/
1042 |     if( !stat( buffer, &stats)) {
1043 | 	if( check_magic( buffer, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE, 
1044 | 	    MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH)) {
1045 | 	    /**
1046 | 	     **  Set the flags to 'load only'. This prevents from accidently
1047 | 	     **  printing something
1048 | 	     **/
1049 | 	    save_flags = g_flags;
1050 | 	    g_flags = M_LOAD;
1051 | 	    /**
1052 | 	     **  Source now
1053 | 	     **/
1054 | 	    if( TCL_ERROR == Execute_TclFile( interp, buffer)) 
1055 | 		if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_SOURCE, LOC, buffer, NULL)) 
1056 | 		    Result = TCL_ERROR;
1057 | 	    g_flags = save_flags;
1058 | 	    /**
1059 | 	     **  Save the currently sourced file in the list
1060 | 	     **  Check whether the list is big enough to fit in a new entry
1061 | 	     **/
1062 | 	    if( !listsize) {
1063 | 		listsize = SRCFRAG;
1064 | 		if((char **) NULL
1065 | 			== (srclist = (char **) module_malloc( listsize *
1066 | 		    sizeof( char **)))) {
1067 | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
1068 | 		    goto unwind1;
1069 | 		}
1070 | 	    } else if( listndx + 1 >= listsize) {
1071 | 		listsize += SRCFRAG;
1072 | 		if((char **) NULL == (srclist = (char **) realloc( srclist, 
1073 | 		    listsize * sizeof( char **)))) {
1074 | 		    ErrorLogger( ERR_ALLOC, LOC, NULL);
1075 | 		    goto unwind1;
1076 | 		}
1077 | 	    }
1078 | 	    /**
1079 | 	     **  Put the current RC files name on the list
1080 | 	     **/
1081 | 	    srclist[ listndx++] = buffer;
1082 | 
1083 | 	} else {
1084 | 	    ErrorLogger( ERR_MAGIC, LOC, buffer, NULL);
1085 | 	    null_free((void *) &buffer);
1086 | 	}
1087 |     } else {	/** if( !stat) - presumably not found **/
1088 | 	null_free((void *) &buffer);
1089 |     }
1090 |     /**
1091 |      **  Return our result
1092 |      **/
1093 |     return( Result);
1094 | 
1095 | unwind1:
1096 |     null_free((void *) &buffer);
1097 | unwind0:
1098 |     return( TCL_ERROR);
1099 | 
1100 | } /** End of 'SourceRC' **/
1101 | 
1102 | /*++++
1103 |  ** ** Function-Header ***************************************************** **
1104 |  ** 									     **
1105 |  **   Function:		SourceVers					     **
1106 |  ** 									     **
1107 |  **   Description:	Source the '.version' file			     **
1108 |  ** 									     **
1109 |  **   First Edition:	1991/10/23					     **
1110 |  ** 									     **
1111 |  **   Parameters:	Tcl_Interp	*interp		Tcl interpreter	     **
1112 |  **			char		*path		Path to be used      **
1113 |  **			char		*name		Name of the module   **
1114 |  **									     **
1115 |  **   Result:		int		TCL_OK		Success		     **
1116 |  **					TCL_ERROR	Failure		     **
1117 |  **									     **
1118 |  **   Attached Globals:	g_flags		These are set up accordingly before  **
1119 |  **					this function is called in order to  **
1120 |  **					control everything		     **
1121 |  ** 									     **
1122 |  ** ************************************************************************ **
1123 |  ++++*/
1124 | 
1125 | int SourceVers( Tcl_Interp *interp, char *path, char *name)
1126 | {
1127 |     struct stat	  stats;		/** Buffer for the stat() systemcall **/
1128 |     int save_flags;
1129 |     char *buffer;
1130 |     int Result = TCL_OK;
1131 |     char *version;
1132 |     char *new_argv[3];
1133 |     char *mod, *ver;
1134 | 
1135 |     /**
1136 |      **  If there's a problem with the input parameters it means, that
1137 |      **  we do not have to source anything
1138 |      **  Only a valid TCL interpreter should be there
1139 |      **/
1140 |     if( !path || !name)
1141 | 	return( TCL_OK);
1142 |     if( !interp)
1143 | 	return( TCL_ERROR);
1144 |     /**
1145 |      **  No default version defined so far?
1146 |      **/
1147 |     if( VersionLookup( name, &mod, &ver) &&
1148 | 	strcmp( ver, _(em_default)))
1149 | 	return( TCL_OK);
1150 |     /**
1151 |      **  Build the full name of the RC file and check whether it exists and
1152 |      **  has the magic cookie inside
1153 |      **/
1154 |     if ((char *) NULL == (buffer = stringer(NULL, 0, path,"/",version_file,
1155 | 	NULL)))
1156 | 	if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
1157 | 	    return( TCL_ERROR);
1158 |     if( !stat( buffer, &stats)) {
1159 | 	if(
1160 | #if VERSION_MAGIC != 0
1161 | 	    check_magic( buffer, MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE, 
1162 | 	    MODULES_MAGIC_COOKIE_LENGTH)
1163 | #else
1164 | 	1
1165 | #endif
1166 | 	) {
1167 | 	    save_flags = g_flags;
1168 | 	    g_flags = M_LOAD;
1169 | 
1170 | 	    if( TCL_ERROR != (Result = Execute_TclFile( interp, buffer)) && 
1171 | 		(version = (char *) Tcl_GetVar(interp, "ModulesVersion", 0))) {
1172 | 		/**
1173 | 		 **  The version has been specified in the
1174 | 		 **  '.version' file. Set up the result code
1175 | 		 **/
1176 | 		null_free((void *) &buffer);
1177 | 		if ((char *) NULL == (buffer = stringer(NULL, 0,
1178 | 		name,"/",version, NULL)))
1179 | 		    if( OK != ErrorLogger( ERR_STRING, LOC, NULL))
1180 | 			return( TCL_ERROR);
1181 | 
1182 | 		new_argv[0] = "module-version";
1183 | 		new_argv[1] = buffer;
1184 | 		new_argv[2] = _(em_default);
1185 | 		/**
1186 | 		 **  Define the default version
1187 | 		 **/
1188 | 		if( TCL_OK != cmdModuleVersion( (ClientData) 0,
1189 | 		    (Tcl_Interp *) NULL, 3, (CONST84 char **) new_argv)) {
1190 | 			Result = TCL_ERROR;
1191 | 		}
1192 | 	    } /** if( Execute...) **/
1193 | 
1194 | 	    g_flags = save_flags;
1195 | 
1196 | 	} else
1197 | 	    ErrorLogger( ERR_MAGIC, LOC, buffer, NULL);
1198 | 
1199 |     } /** if( !stat) **/
1200 |     /**
1201 |      ** free buffer memory
1202 |      **/
1203 |     null_free((void *) &buffer);
1204 |     /**
1205 |      **  Result determines if this was successful
1206 |      **/
1207 | 
1208 |     return( Result);
1209 | 
1210 | } /** End of 'SourceVers' **/
1211 |
